refnamediv.refpurpose: Join array elements with a string

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
Returns a string containing a string representation of all the array elements in the same order, with the glue string between each element.
implode example
<?php
$array = array('lastname', 'email', 'phone'); $comma_separated = implode(",", $array);
print $comma_separated; // lastname,email,phone
?>

note.para: implode can, for historical reasons, accept its parameters in either order. For consistency with explode, however, it may be less confusing to use the documented order of arguments.
As of PHP 4.3.0, the glue parameter of implode is optional and defaults to the empty string('').
